sentences: Hänen vanhempiensa talo oli elin hyvin suuri.
context: The Finnish word 'elin' is an archaic or dialectal form of the word 'eläin', which means 'animal'. In modern standard Finnish, 'eläin' is the common term for animals in general. The word can refer to any living creature, from domestic pets to wild animals. It's used as a noun and follows normal Finnish declension patterns.
